title: CDA Chairman visits Azerbaijan Embassy to offer condolences
content:
ISLAMABAD, Dec 27 (APP):Chairman Capital Development Authority (CDA), Muhammad Ali Randhawa on Friday express condolences to Ambassador Khazar Farhadov over the tragic loss of lives in a recent plane crash in Azerbaijan.
During the visit to the Azerbaijan Embassy, Randhawa conveyed deep sorrow over the incident and extended prayers for the departed souls, as well as sympathies to the grieving families.
He also wished for the speedy recovery of those injured in the accident.
Speaking on the occasion, the CDA Chairman said, “We stand shoulder to shoulder with the people of Azerbaijan during this moment of grief.”
He emphasized the enduring ties between Pakistan and Azerbaijan, rooted in shared religious and cultural values, and reaffirmed Pakistan’s unwavering support for the Azerbaijani people in their time of mourning.
As a mark of respect, Randhawa also penned a condolence note to honor the victims.
Ambassador Farhadov expressed his appreciation for the Chairman’s visit and solidarity, highlighting the strong relations between the two nations.
